    • Method Detail

      • isEmpty

        public static <T> boolean isEmpty(T[] array)
        Checks to see if an array is empty

        An empty array is one that is null or has zero elements. Everything else is considered non-empty.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the array
        Parameters:
        array - The array to check
        Returns:
        true if the collection is null or empty, false otherwise

      • isNotEmpty

        public static <T> boolean isNotEmpty(T[] array)
        Checks to see if an array is not empty

        An empty array is one that is null or has zero elements. Everything else is considered non-empty.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the array
        Parameters:
        array - The array to check
        Returns:
        true if the collection not empty, false otherwise

      • isEmpty

        public static <T> boolean isEmpty(Collection<T> collection)
        Checks to see if a collection is empty

        An empty collection is one that is null or has zero elements. Everything else is considered non-empty.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the collection
        Parameters:
        collection - The collection to check
        Returns:
        true if the collection is null or empty, false otherwise

      • isNotEmpty

        public static <T> boolean isNotEmpty(Collection<T> collection)
        Checks to see if a collection is populated

        An empty collection is one that is null or has zero elements. Everything else is considered non-empty.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the collection
        Parameters:
        collection - The collection to check
        Returns:
        true if the collection is not null and has at least one element, false otherwise

      • ensureEmpty

        public static <T> List<T> ensureEmpty(List<T> list)
        Ensures that we always have an empty list rather than null
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of objects in the list
        Parameters:
        list - The list to check
        Returns:
        An empty and modifiable list if the argument was null, the original list otherwise

      • unmodifiableList

        public static <T> List<T> unmodifiableList(List<T> list)
        Returns a wrapper on the specified list which throws an UnsupportedOperationException whenever an attempt is made to modify the list.

        This is a thin wrapper around unmodifiableList(java.util.List) which will ensure that it won't throw an NullPointerException if the supplied list is null.

        Parameters:
        list - the list to wrap in an unmodifiable list.
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable List.

      • combineLists

        public static <T> List<T> combineLists(List<T>... lists)
        Combines a number of lists of the specified type into one list by using Collections.addAll(java.util.Collection, Object[])
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the list
        Parameters:
        lists - The lists to combine
        Returns:
        A list that contains all of the values from the parameters. If no values were found to combine then this will return an empty list.
